A railway track or railroad track is a structure consisting of two or more rails, typically secured within a foundation.
A railroad track is a structure consisting of two parallel steel rails, anchored perpendicular to beams of timber, concrete or steel, to maintain a consistent distance apart, or gauge.
A railroad track is a structure consisting of two parallel steel rails, secured to sleepers, and embedded in ballast.
A railroad track is a track for the movement of rail cars.
A construction site is an area where construction work is taking place. It contains aspects of formwork, scaffolding, excavation, concrete and reinforcement.
A railway track is a permanent way made of rails, commonly known as tracks, for a train to travel.
A railroad track is a structure consisting of two parallel steel rails, secured to sleepers (also known as crossties or railroad ties) and embedded in ballast.

A railroad is a permanent roadbed or railway track for the movement of trains.
A construction site is an area where construction work is taking place. It contains aspects of formwork and falsework.
A railway track or railroad track is a set of two parallel steel rails, generally anchored perpendicular to beams from which the rails are suspended.

a railroad is a permanent roadbed or railway laid with rails, commonly in two or more parallel lines that are used for the transportation of people and goods.

Construction is the process of constructing a building or infrastructure. Construction differs from manufacturing in that manufacturing typically involves mass production of similar items without a designated purchaser, while construction typically takes place on location for a known client.
A railroad is a form of transport which uses steel rails to carry trains.
A railroad is a transport system.

A construction site is a busy place with many people and large vehicles moving around.
A building or edifice is a structure with a roof and walls standing more or less permanently in one place, such as a house or factory.
A construction worker is a tradesperson, laborer, or professional employed in the physical construction of the built environment and its infrastructure.

A train station is a railway facility or area where trains regularly stop to load or unload passengers or freight. It generally consists of at least one track-side platform and a station building (depot) providing such ancillary services as ticket sales and waiting rooms.
A house is a building that is made for people to live in.
A house is a building that people live in.
